ThingDef.label: eggplant plant
ThingDef.description: Purple variety of the eggplant. Bitter when eaten raw.

ThingDef.label: pumpkin plant
ThingDef.description: Large orange version of the squash plant. Often carved to ward off ghosts.

ThingDef.label: squash plant
ThingDef.description: Yellow variety of the squash family.

ThingDef.label: tomato vine
ThingDef.description: Distinctive red fruit that grows best in rich soil.

ThingDef.label: carrot plant
ThingDef.description: A long orange vegetable that grows quickly, with a low yield.

ThingDef.label: kiwi plant
ThingDef.description: An edible berry that is oval about the size of a large hen's egg and has a fibrous, dull greenish-brown skin and bright green or golden flesh with rows of tiny, black, edible seeds. The fruit has a soft texture with a sweet and unique flavour.

ThingDef.label: mango tree
ThingDef.description: A juicy stone fruit from tropical trees. The fruits may be somewhat round, oval, or kidney-shaped. It's skin is leather-like, waxy, smooth, and fragrant, with color ranging from green to yellow, yellow-orange, yellow-red, or blushed with various shades of red, pink or yellow when fully ripe.

ThingDef.label: avocado tree
ThingDef.description: A fast growing tree that produces avocado fruit, Avocado is a single-seeded berry with a tough skin. It is a pear-shaped fruit and has a large central seed.

ThingDef.Name: ItemSpawnerBase
ThingDef.description: null

ThingDef.label: three sisters plant CBS
ThingDef.description: Corn Bean Squash. Natives use this technique known as companion planting the three crops are planted close together and benefit from each other. The corn provides a structure for the beans to climb, eliminating the need for poles. The beans provide the nourishment to the soil, and the squash spreads along the ground, blocking the sunlight, helping prevent the establishment of weeds.

The corn provides a structure for the beans to climb, eliminating the need for poles. ThingDef.label: Pomato
ThingDef.description: Pomato

ThingDef.label: pumpkin plant
ThingDef.description: Large orange version of the squash plant. Often carved to ward off ghosts.

ThingDef.label: squash plant
ThingDef.description: Yellow variety of the squash family.

ThingDef.label: blue corn plant
ThingDef.description: A tall grain plant which produces ears of soft, edible seeds. While blue corn takes a long time to grow, it yields lots of food compared to other crops. Harvested blue corn takes a long time to spoil. Grows well even poor soil.

ThingDef.label: tomato vine
ThingDef.description: Distinctive red fruit that grows best in rich soil.

ThingDef.label: Orchard's Guild ABB
ThingDef.description: Apples Beans Berries. A fruit bearing tree that grows apples with the companion crops of beans and berries. Is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: Orchard's Guild ALB
ThingDef.description: Apples Lentils Berries. A fruit bearing tree that grows apples with companion crops of lentils and berries. Is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: Orchard's Guild PBB
ThingDef.description: Peaches Beans Berries. A fruit bearing tree that grows peaches with the companion crops of beans and berries. Is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: Orchard's Guild PLB
ThingDef.description: Peaches Lentils Berries. A fruit bearing tree that grows peaches with companion crops of lentils and berries. Is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: japanese maple tree
ThingDef.description: These beautiful trees have branches that twist and turn unpredictably and brilliant orange and red foliage that draws the eye.

ThingDef.label: cherry blossom tree
ThingDef.description: Cherry blossom trees are not just a good source of building materials, they are also one of the most beautiful trees to have in your lawn.

ThingDef.label: camellia tree
ThingDef.description: This small ornamental tree has beautiful flowers that have been known to stay healthy even through tough winter conditions.

ThingDef.label: acacia tree
ThingDef.description: Acacia trees are hardy and can grow in the toughest desert environments. They don't provide much wood and they have sharp thorns too.

ThingDef.label: red maple tree
ThingDef.description: A soft wood tree. Known for it's red leaves.

ThingDef.label: Assorted Tree
ThingDef.description: A random tree. More for Decoration then for wood. Grows a bit faster. Does not change colors for seasons.

ThingDef.label: allium giganteum
ThingDef.description: A beautiful cultivated flower, dark purple bulb.

ThingDef.label: anthurium
ThingDef.description: A beautiful cultivated red flower.

ThingDef.label: NymphHair
ThingDef.description: A beautiful blueish grass.

ThingDef.label: PinkRimstalk
ThingDef.description: A beautiful cultivated long stemmed pink flower.

ThingDef.label: Plumeria
ThingDef.description: A beautiful cultivated small bushy flower that grows in random colors.

ThingDef.label: Sunflower
ThingDef.description: A beautiful tall growing bright yellow flower.

ThingDef.label: Assorted Flowers
ThingDef.description: A random flower.

ThingDef.label: allium giganteum
ThingDef.description: A beautiful cultivated flower, dark purple bulb.

ThingDef.label: anthurium
ThingDef.description: A beautiful cultivated red flower.

ThingDef.label: NymphHair
ThingDef.description: A beautiful blueish grass.

ThingDef.label: PinkRimstalk
ThingDef.description: A beautiful cultivated long stemmed pink flower.

ThingDef.label: Plumeria
ThingDef.description: A beautiful cultivated small bushy flower that grows in random colors.

ThingDef.label: Assorted Flowers
ThingDef.description: A random flower.

ThingDef.label: ironwood tree
ThingDef.description: Ironwood trees got their name from the legendary strength of the wood.

ThingDef.label: chopped ironwood stump
ThingDef.description: A stump left behind after a ironwood tree has been felled. The stump can be extracted but yields very little usable ironwood. Left outdoors, the stump will deteriorate in time.

ThingDef.label: smashed ironwood stump
ThingDef.description: The remnants of a ironwood tree destroyed by damage. It's ugly. The stump can be extracted but yields very little usable ironwood. Left outdoors, the stump will deteriorate in time.

ThingDef.label: apple tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows apples and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: banana tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows banana and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: orange tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows oranges and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: peach tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows peaches and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: date palm tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows dates and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: fig tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows figs and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: coconut tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows coconuts and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: cherry tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows cherries and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: pineapple plant
ThingDef.description: Think skin fruit that grows a top a bush.

ThingDef.label: cloudberry plant
ThingDef.description: A berry bush that grows well in cold climates.

ThingDef.label: gooseberry plant
ThingDef.description: A berry bush that grows well in cold climates.

ThingDef.label: Mushroom
ThingDef.description: This robust mushroom has been genetically engineered and cultivated to produce a filling meat substitute. Found in the wild and grown in hydroponics.

ThingDef.label: bee hive
ThingDef.description: A hive of bees. Harvest them for honey.

ThingDef.label: garden rose
ThingDef.description: A beautiful cultivated flower, the rose has been a symbol of love since Earth's ancient era.

ThingDef.label: garden daylily
ThingDef.description: A cultivated flower with wide petals and a short lifespan. Daylilies are very beautiful, but must be replanted often.

ThingDef.label: Plumeria
ThingDef.description: A beautiful cultivated small bushy flower that grows in random colors.

ThingDef.label: Plumeria
ThingDef.description: A beautiful cultivated small bushy flower that grows in random colors.

ThingDef.label: chokevine
ThingDef.description: Tangled masses of cord-like, spiky vines which coil in great masses along the ground. Chokevine greatky slows down anyone who moves over it. Multiple tribes have independently generated stories of chokevine strangling children to death in the night, as a way to scare kids into coming home before dark.

ThingDef.label: grass
ThingDef.description: Wild grass. Grows anywhere there is a little light and minimally fertile ground.

ThingDef.label: tall grass
ThingDef.description: Wild tall grass. Slows down anyone moving over it.

ThingDef.label: cave grass
ThingDef.description: cave grass. Grows anywhere there is a no light and minimally fertile ground.

ThingDef.label: barley plant
ThingDef.description: A cereal grain. Hearty plant that is imune to blight. Used in cooking and for making ale.

ThingDef.label: pincushion cactus
ThingDef.description: A short cactus. It is so named because it resembles a pincushion.

ThingDef.label: snow beet plant
ThingDef.description: A simple, highly nutritious plants. Grows well even in somewhat poor soil. Harvests quickly. A strong, versatile crop. Does not die in cold weather.

ThingDef.label: red lentil plant
ThingDef.description: A redish variety of the lentil plant. One of the oldest know domesticated plants.

ThingDef.label: bean plant
ThingDef.description: Common bean cooked up in many ways. Will not die due to toxic fallout.

ThingDef.label: olive tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows olives and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: pineapple plant
ThingDef.description: Think skin fruit that grows a top a bush.

ThingDef.label: cloudberry plant
ThingDef.description: A berry bush that grows well in cold climates.

ThingDef.label: gooseberry plant
ThingDef.description: A berry bush that grows well in cold climates.

ThingDef.label: grape vine
ThingDef.description: A sweet small fruit that grows in small viney bushes.

ThingDef.label: blueberry plant
ThingDef.description: Blue colored berry that grows in bushes.

ThingDef.label: watermelon plant
ThingDef.description: This fruit is rich in vitamins A and C and can be eaten raw or cooked in a variety of ways.

ThingDef.label: garden agave
ThingDef.description: A large-leafed desert plant with edible flowers and stalks.

ThingDef.label: tea plant
ThingDef.description: A green leafy plant, who's leaves can be brewed into a tasty beverage.

ThingDef.label: coffee plant
ThingDef.description: A green, leafy plant yielding coffee beans. These beans can be brewed into a tasty beverage.

ThingDef.label: bamboo plant
ThingDef.description: A fast-growing tree-like species that grows in cluster. Bamboo can be harvested for a wood-like material. The plant itself is not beautiful.

ThingDef.label: cocoa bush
ThingDef.description: A tropical bush that produces chocolate, genetically engineered to sweeten its own product, and survive in slightly less-warm climates. Produces a lot less then the trees.

ThingDef.label: bee tree
ThingDef.description: A genetically engineered birch tree, designed to attract bees to build a hive in.

ThingDef.label: apple tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows apples and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: banana tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows banana and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: orange tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows oranges and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: peach tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows peaches and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: date palm tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows dates and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: fig tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows figs and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: coconut tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows coconuts and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: cherry tree
ThingDef.description: A fruit bearing tree that grows cherries and is not destroyed when picked.

ThingDef.label: ambrosia bush
ThingDef.description: A bush which yields the ambrosia fruit. Ambrosia is pleasurable to eat and produces a slightly addictive chemical warmth effect. Grown in a Hydroponics basin. Does not destroy when harvested.

ThingDef.label: baby agarilux
ThingDef.description: An purple mushroom. Its size and glowing protrusions make this fungus beautiful to look at. Dies when exposed to light. Faster grow than the kind that grow in nature, but also has a much smaller yield

ThingDef.label: steel shroom tree
ThingDef.description: Fungi have always had a remarkable ability to draw iron up from the ground. The Steel Shroom Tree, however, takes this beyond its logical extreme. Over time this fungal mass produces toadstool like growths, the waste byproduct of the fungi consuming mass amounts of iron for energy. Created on Urbworlds to help meet their ever growing need for steel by fugative Glitterworld scientists, in rare cases they have run wild, eventually overrunning the planet. Without sufficient metal readily accessible this is not a threat.

ThingDef.label: plasteel bulb
ThingDef.description: Plasteel bulbs are soft gelatinous blobs which draw unrefined plasteel from the environment around them into their form. As they mature they slowly harden as the plasteel takes up a higher percentage of their body. Surprisingly, they aren't actually a plant at all, but a small, imobile and utterly helpless critter. The harvested body that may be refined is their skeleton, which in actuality is nothing more than a lifeless husk. Seeds for more plasteel bulbs are always found within this husk, meaning this lifeform is reliant upon the refinement process to reproduce.

ThingDef.label: gold fern
ThingDef.description: Gold fern are an unusual herb which draw nutrients from the soil and, via chemical process, convert them into a molecular structure indistinguishable from gold. Engineered on Glitterworlds, the exact process is not easily understood. What is understood is that the mature fronds are effectively made of gold, and at that point the "how" kind of ceases to matter.

ThingDef.label: jade crystal
ThingDef.description: Crystalline formations grown in leaf like patterns which utilize photosynthesis for energy. Raw jade flows in the veins amongst liquid. Created by Glitterworld scientists as "modern art" it finds new purpose on rimworlds.

ThingDef.label: silver flower
ThingDef.description: Money does not grow on trees. Obviously. It grows on flowers. - Old Glitterwold joke. As silver came to be accepted as a universal currency, means to obtain more became among the most pressing of matters. The most advanced worlds lead this search, several of which became prominent Glitterworlds after the invention of this beautiful flower. Razor sharp silver petals radiate from a thorny stem. Growing these requires care and attention, however it is the harvest that is by far the most difficult stage.

ThingDef.label: uranium root
ThingDef.description: All things are subject to radiation. And, once irradiated, tend to radiate it outwards as the poison works out it's half-life. As with most things, the Uranium Root plant absorbs radiation. Unlike most things it has a unique way of dealing with it. The plant itself is highly sensitive to radiation, but draws in a huge variety of minerals and nutrients from the soil, including Uranium. It pumps excess nutrients into bulbous protrusions on its roots, and uses them to seal off the Uranium. These capsules contain the radiation so completely that they may be safely handled without the need for even token protective gear. While tricky to cultivate, it is completely safe, and may even be planted near edibles.

ThingDef.label: bioferrite tree
ThingDef.description: Strange Crystal-like plant that produces Bioferrite. Only grows in dark places.

ThingDef.label: Diamond plant
ThingDef.description: Crystals taken from a Diamond plant. May be smelted into usable Diamond at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Ruby plant
ThingDef.description: Crystals taken from a Ruby plant. May be smelted into usable Ruby at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Sapphire plant
ThingDef.description: Crystals taken from a Sapphire plant. May be smelted into usable Sapphire at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: ceramite flower
ThingDef.description: Harvesting the bulbs of the ceramite flower, Once separated from the chaff, the bulbs may be smelted at an Electric Smelter into usable ceramite.

ThingDef.label: adamantium plant
ThingDef.description: Bulbs taken from a adamantium plant. May be smelted into usable uranium at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Amethyst plant
ThingDef.description: Crystals taken from a amethyst plant. May be smelted into usable amethyst at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Chalcedony plant
ThingDef.description: Crystals taken from a Chalcedony plant. May be smelted into usable Chalcedony at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Citrine plant
ThingDef.description: Crystals taken from a Citrine plant. May be smelted into usable Citrine at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Diamond plant
ThingDef.description: Crystals taken from a Diamond plant. May be smelted into usable Diamond at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Emerald plant
ThingDef.description: Crystals taken from a Emerald plant. May be smelted into usable Emerald at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Garnet plant
ThingDef.description: Crystals taken from a Garnet plant. May be smelted into usable Garnet at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Lapis plant
ThingDef.description: Crystals taken from a Lapis plant. May be smelted into usable Lapis at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Quartz plant
ThingDef.description: Crystals taken from a Quartz plant. May be smelted into usable Quartz at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Ruby plant
ThingDef.description: Crystals taken from a Ruby plant. May be smelted into usable Ruby at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Sapphire plant
ThingDef.description: Crystals taken from a Sapphire plant. May be smelted into usable Sapphire at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Serpentine plant
ThingDef.description: Crystals taken from a Serpentine plant. May be smelted into usable Serpentine at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Turquoise plant
ThingDef.description: Crystals taken from a Turquoise plant. May be smelted into usable Turquoise at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Neutro Flower
ThingDef.description: A beautiful yellow-orange flower. Used to make Neutroamine, a medicine base.

ThingDef.label: glitterworld alyssum
ThingDef.description: A beautiful red flower. Used to make Glitterworld neutroamine, a drug and medicine base.

ThingDef.label: Neutro Deco Flower
ThingDef.description: A beautiful yellow-orange flower. Smaller in size only used for decoration. Does not produce Neutroamine.

ThingDef.label: tobacco plant
ThingDef.description: A green, leafy plant. Use in making cigarillos.

ThingDef.label: dandelion patch
ThingDef.description: Through agriculture techniques, the wild dandelion can now be grown in larger patches, that can be harvested for it medical properties. It is a yellow flower which grows in large clusters. Though it is often considered a weed, dandelions in bloom are quite beautiful.

ThingDef.label: ambrosia bush
ThingDef.description: A bush which yields the ambrosia fruit. Ambrosia is pleasurable to eat and produces a slightly addictive chemical warmth effect. Grown in a Hydroponics basin. Does not destroy when harvested.

ThingDef.label: wheat plant
ThingDef.description: Wheat is a cereal grain, can be milled into flour.

ThingDef.label: sugarcane plant
ThingDef.description: Cane plant refines into sugar.

ThingDef.label: flax flower
ThingDef.description: A flower thats fibers are use to spin into cloth.

RecipeDef.label: make guacamole
RecipeDef.description: Guacamole is a creamy, avocado-based food. Made from tomatoes and avocados.

ThingDef.label: lemon tree
ThingDef.description: A tall tree native to both deserts and tropics alike. Bright, sour lemons grow profusely on this tree, some lemons may even mature early and fall to the ground before the primary harvest is ready.

ThingDef.label: mint plant
ThingDef.description: A plant sprouting into an array of mint leaves. Mint leaves are infamous for their cooling effect on one's mouth, as well as ease of seeping into an array of teas or delicately garnishing a dish. Flourishes indoors and in plant pots, while being pleasant to look at.
